channel.title: CiTR -- CabaRadio
channel.description: A late night variety show for the world of Cabaret, hosted by Teddy Smooth. Tune in for interviews, skits, musicals guest and more. It's Radio with Sass!
channel.itunes:summary: A late night variety show for the world of Cabaret, hosted by Teddy Smooth. Tune in for interviews, skits, musicals guest and more. It's Radio with Sass!
channel.itunes:author: CiTR 101.9 Vancouver

item.title: The very last show! So much fun...one last time!!
item.description:
Tonight we say goodbye and thank you to CiTR 101.9fm
CabaRadio with Teddy Smooth presents "The Very Last Show!" Yes indeed, after 3+ years on the radio Teddy & Eroc will say their final farewells tonight on CiTR Radio 101.9FM. Join us as we play some 'Best of' moments and play the music from some of bands we've had on the show over the years, including the Creaking Planks, The Oh Wells, Billy the Kid, Gastown Royals, Warless, Rick Valiant, Natalie Edward and many more! Plus our theatre guru Franklin T. Schneider returns to give us one last look at the Vancouver theatre scene! Also the Sketchy Sluts stop by to spice up the airwaves! Upcoming events, prizes and so much more!!
CabaRadio with Teddy Smooth CiTR 101.9fm or listen online http://citr.ca/
So much fun...one last time!!
-----------------------------------------------------

item.title: #144 - Behind the tassels - CabaRadio delves into the 7th Annual Vancouver Internatioanal Burlesque Festival!
item.description:
Tonight on CabaRadio with Teddy Smooth, Teddy & Eroc go under the tassel with the The 7th Annual Vancouver International Burlesque Festival! Festival president Roxette Starr and member at large Blue Morris stop by to give us the low down on this years festival. Also Sparkle-Plenty talks with us about her show in the festival Bender In Bermuda: Dances At the Devil's Triangle one of the big productions that will open the festival at the RIO THEATRE! Plus Teddy & Eroc plays clips of some of the best moments of last years festival. *Special prize giveaway to this years Burlesque Festival! Plus tickets to 'Evil Dead the Musical'* TUNE IN TO WIN!!
Plus upcoming events, groovy tunes and a few surprises!!
http://www.vanburlesquefest.com/

item.title: #143 - You Pick the Playlist with DJ Lexis!
item.description:
Over the years of doing a radio show, a lot of people have come up and said "oh, it would be so cool to do a radio show" or "I wish I could do what you do". So that got CabaRadio to thinking...why not give you the chance to do just that!? That's when we came up with the idea of 'You pick the Playlist' a show where you, one of our listeners gets to come on the show and pick the music for the night. Not only that but you get to talk about why you wanted it played, or what it means to you, or hell maybe you just really dig the song! Maybe you want to play an 80's set, or a punk set, maybe you are like us and you wanna play a whole bunch of different music all on the same show or maybe just maybe you are a musician and you wanna showcase all your own stuff, you can do that to...it's your Playlist! Their are a few rules of course, like you have to play some Canadian Content aka CANCON and you have to play some female content aka FEMCON but other than that, the mic and music is all yours.
Join us tonight http://citr.ca/ at 11pm as sexy librarian DJ Lexis picks the playlist! DJ Alexis brings the spirit of the of the Big Easy as Teddy & Eroc sit back, crack a cold one and listen in as one of our listeners picks the music for the night Tune in to hear DJ Lexis as she becomes CabaRadio's DJ!!
The adventure awaits tonight at 11pm on CITR 101.9fm or online at http://citr.ca/
PS if you would like to Pick the Playlist some night on CabaRadio please email us at cabaradio@gmail.com with the subject "I wanna pick the playlist" We do it every couple of months, so sign up now and start picking your list!
Talk to you tonight!
CabaRadio with Teddy Smooth Tuesdays at 11pm CITR 101.9fm or online at http://citr.ca/
-----------------------------------------------------

item.title: #142 - Let's buy a Canadian a coffee show!
item.description:
CabaRadio with Teddy Smooth present the "Let's buy a Canadian a coffee show!" tonight at 11pm on CiTR Radio 101.9FM or online www.citr.ca With SOCAN monitoring our airwaves Teddy & Eroc show their Canadian brethren some love and play their tunes. Every time SOCAN hears a Canadian, it pays that Canadian some cold, hard cash! So tune in and hear us give back to the musicians who make Canadian music so diverse and amazing! Plus we talk with Corinne Lea of the Rio theatre and hear all the latest in their struggle with the liquor board. CabaRadio, always fun and always new!
Talk to you later.
CITR 101.9fm or online at http://citr.ca/
-----------------------------------------------------

item.title: The All Night Fund Drive Show Part 2!! We need your help to help keep CiTR tuned into the future!
item.description:
Tonight is the night! CabaRadio presents "The All Night Fund Drive Show!" 8 straight hours of CabaRadio! Teddy & Eroc welcome the talents of Michael Fraser & his violin! Plus the late night comedy hour with Sean Plumridge! And much more! CiTR 101.9fm is hoping to raise $35,000 with funds going toward our operating budget and special project...s such as digitizing our 30k+ library of CDs, helping to bring us into the future of broadcast radio. We want to remain relevant, accessible and unequivocally awesome through 2012 and beyond! CabaRadio's individual goal is $300, and we need your help to get there! Make a pledge! Whether it's $5, $10 or $500, no amount is too little or two much! Please visit www.citr.ca/donate or call 604 822 8648(UNiT) Listen to the podcast and donate!! item.title: #103 - Boobs, balls, tassels and twirling! It's Festival time!
item.description:
The 6th Annual Vancouver International Burlesque Festival is only days away and this year promises to be bigger, sexier and sassier then ever! With two nights at the Rickshaw and a big Saturday show at the historic Vogue Theatre, the festival will showcase local and international stars, including, Roxi Dlite MISS EXOTIC WORLD 2010 ~ REIGNING QUEEN OF BURLESQUE!! Plus back by popular demand, BRITISH COLUMBIA'S OWN JUDITH STEIN ~ LEGENDARY MISTRESS OF THE STAGE
Tonight on CabaRadio, Teddy & Eroc sit down with the VIBF board to talk about all the excitement and anticipation surrounding this years festival. Plus Bloody Betty is back on the program to discuss her first ever show at the festival.
Check out the festival website to buy tickets: http://www.vanburlesquefest.com/index.html
Great article in the Straight about the festival: http://www.straight.com/article-390699/vancouver/sixth-annual-vancouver-international-burlesque-festival-goes-grand

item.title: #102 - CabaRadio gets political! Do you have an opinion? Plus live music!
item.description:

Don't have a ride to where you vote? Guests from Riding 4 Ridings stop by to talk politics and how they are going to get you to your polls! http://www.facebook.com/event.php?eid=192116570831669 http://www.transformationprojects.ca/index.php/set/projects
Plus music by Frenchman Fred Fresh http://fredfresh.de/ and Comedy / Country / Folk artist Shirley Gnome http://www.myspace.com/shirleygnome

item.title: Lola Frost takes over CabaRadio! Plus Teddy announces major news!
item.description:
Over the years of doing a radio show, a lot of people have come up and said "oh, it would be so cool to do a radio show" or "I wish I could do what you do". So that got CabaRadio to thinking...why not give you the chance to do just that!? That's when we came up with the idea of 'You pick the Playlist' a show where you, one of our listeners gets to come on the show and pick the music for the night. Not only that but you get to talk about why you wanted it played, or what it means to you, or hell maybe you just really dig the song! Maybe you want to play an 80's set, or a punk set, maybe you are like us and you wanna play a whole bunch of different music all on the same show or maybe just maybe you are a musician and you wanna showcase all your own stuff, you can do that to...it's your Playlist! Their are a few rules of course, like you have to play some Canadian Content aka CANCON and you have to play some female content aka FEMCON but other than that, the mic and music is all yours.
Join us tonight http://citr.ca/ at 11pm as the dramatic, seductive, sexy and sweet Lola Frost picks the playlist! This burlesque vixen has always had an ear for great music and it's sure to be a dazzling array of tunes! Tune in to hear Lola Frost as she becomes CabaRadio's DJ for the night!!
The adventure awaits tonight at 11pm on CITR 101.9fm or online at http://citr.ca/
PS if you would like to Pick the Playlist some night on CabaRadio please email us at cabaradio@gmail.com with the subject "I wanna pick the playlist" We do it every couple of months, so sign up now and start picking your list!
Talk to you tonight!
CabaRadio with Teddy Smooth Tuesdays at 11pm CITR 101.9fm or online at http://citr.ca/
----------------------------------------------------- NEXT WEEK!
Cabaradio with Teddy Smooth is looking for unique, interesting artists of any sort, ie. musicians, comedians, spoken word, unicyclists....... well maybe not the last one, after all this is radio, to be apart of our fourth installment of "EROC'S TALENT SHOWCASE" on March 15 2011. If you would like to be a part of the show please contact Eroc at ecarbery@hotmail.com, along with a description of your art and a possible link if you have one. We look forward to hearing from you!! ------------------------------------------------------ MISSED A SHOW?

item.title: #94 - A dedication to YOU the listener! Requested songs! Prizes! Heartfelt thanks!
item.description:
Thanks to you, CabaRadio with Teddy Smooth has been voted one of the best, again! Not only did we grace the cover of "Urban Pie", (http://urbanpie.ca/) but CabaRadio was also voted some of the best in the Westender's yearly "Best of" issue! CabaRadio was voted 2nd best local podcast and Teddy Smooth was voted 3rd best local radio personality! Here at CabaRadio, Teddy and Eroc would like to express their heart felt gratitude for all of you who voted and who support our passion in making a fun, entertaining, often wacky and sometimes serious radio show! And to thank you, tonight the show will be dedicated to you, the listener! We will have prizes including: - Utopia Festival (first annual women in electronic music fest w/Peaches, Isis (ex-Thunderheist), Tanya Tagaq et al. item.title: #81 - Bantering Brassieres, moustache shavings and prizes!
item.description:

Bantering Brassieres is taking some fine ass talent from Vancouvers amazing comedy scene and pairing it with our amazing Burlesque scene! Thus having a night of wild comedy and boozing!
The audience (thats you!) picks a song and then a prop to go along. The dancers do not get to hear the song before hand. item.title: #75 - Covers by others and others and others...You Pick The Playlist returns with Seanic Boom aka Sean Mitchell!!
item.description:
Over the years of doing a radio show, a lot of people have come up and said "oh man, it would be so cool to do a show" or "I wish I could do what you do". So that got CabaRadio to thinking...why not give you the chance to do just that! That's when we came up with the idea of 'You pick the Playlist' a show where you, one of our listeners gets to come on the show and pick the music for the night. Not only that but you get to talk about why you wanted it played, or what it means to you, or hell maybe you just really dig the song! Maybe you want to play an 80's set, or a punk set, maybe you are like us and you wanna play a whole bunch of different music all on the same show or maybe just maybe you are a musician and you wanna showcase all your own stuff, you can do that to...it's your Playlist! Their are a few rules of course, like you have to play some Canadian Content aka CANCON and you have to play some female content aka FEMCON but other than that, the mic and music is all yours.
Join us tonight http://citr.ca/ at 11pm as CabaRadio listener, and YPTPL alumni Seanic Boom returns! Last time Seanic brought us covers by others, songs you thought you knew by one artist but in fact were originally done by another. Tonight, we welcome back and say farewell to Seanic Boom as he sets off to travel the world! Join us for another exciting batch of covers by others! Tune in to hear Seanic Boom aka Sean Mitchell as he becomes CabaRadio's DJ for the night!!
The adventure awaits tonight at 11pm on CITR 101.9fm or online at http://citr.ca/
Let's go!
PS if you would like to Pick the Playlist some night on CabaRadio please email us at cabaradio@gmail.com with the subject "I wanna pick the playlist" We do it every couple of months, so sign up now and start picking your list!
CabaRadio with Teddy Smooth Tuesdays at 11pm CITR 101.9fm or online at http://citr.ca/

item.title: #72 - Thank you for making us 3rd best for the second year in a row!!
item.description:
First thing is first...all of us here at CabaRadio with Teddy Smooth would like to thank you from the bottom of our hearts for taking the time to vote for us in the Georgia Straight's Best of Vancouver competition! With your help CabaRadio was able to come 3rd place for the second year in a row!! Well actually it was best "Late Night Radio Hosts" and Teddy Smooth & Eroc were voted number 3! Let's put this in perspective...first place was a tie between two major radio stations and second place was Alice Cooper...all three of the shows they mentioned are on every night and are on big corporate radio stations...and then their is CabaRadio, we are on once a week and are way out at UBC with a signal that sometimes is hard to get as far away as Commercial Drive...so basically we came first and it's all thanks to your votes! So again THANK YOU!! http://www.straight.com/bov/category/2010/207

item.title: #63 - Cabaradio's Cooking Edition
item.description:
With Teddy away, Eroc will play. Join Eroc as he takes over hosting duties, and welcomes Cousin and Chef, Hugh Carbery. Hugh prepares a succulent three course meal including a cucumber gazpacho, pan seared pork tenderloin with a braised apple, red cabbage slaw, and finally a rum caramelized nectarine with a Chantilly cream. And who doesn't like to sip a bevy while eating. We welcome Patrick Francis, as he pairs drinks with each dish, from a rye Caesar with a bacon garnish, a pinot noir, and a nectarine ginger cocktail.
As always upcoming events
So strip down and tune in!!!!!!!

item.title: #60 - Things get gruesome with Bloody Betty and her sins; plus music Royalty
item.description:
After being on air for just over a year on CITR, CabaRadio w/Teddy Smooth has just received its first evaluation from the station, and CabaRadio is proud to say that CITR wrote the following..."Your show(CabaRadio) stands out as one of the best programs currently running on CiTR"!!
CabaRadio w/Teddy Smooth would like to take this opportunity to thank all of our guest from the past year and a bit for making CabaRadio, fun and memorable! Also a BIG shout out to our recurring characters; Franklin T. Schneider, the Doctor and Crazy Lady...thank you for playing with us!!
However, the BIGGEST SHOUT OUT goes to YOU, the listener!! Without you, the adventure that is CabaRadio would not be as much fun and we couldn't do it without your love, support, comments and suggestions. Thank you to every one, but especially to you, you who have written in, phoned in and listened in! You rock!

item.title: #58 - Summer here and we celebrate with C.R. Avery!
item.description:
The sweet sounds and smells of Summer are finally here! I still have the smells of Portuguese sardines, from the Commercial Drive's Car Free Day in my clothes and I can't seem to get that 6 hour drum beat out of my head! It thumps and thumps as I sit and sip on my freshly muddled Mojitos. Listen.
Tonight on CabaRadio w/Teddy Smooth we are celebrating the first days of Summer with C.R. Avery! "C.R. Avery is a unique, raw and dynamic performer. His genius lies in many genres - blues, hip-hop, spoken word and rock & roll. He is a one-man band, but one for this generation; with the rare ability to sing poetic verse while beatboxing simultaneously while pounding the piano and adding harmonica like a plot twist."
Join us live tonight at 11pm on CITR 101.9fm or online at http://citr.ca/
C.R. is also playing a rare, solo show this Friday at the Cultch; to get your tickets check out: http://www.thecultch.com/ and for more on C.R. Avery check out his website: http://www.cravery.com/
Also on the program tonight is another installment of "Franklin T. Schneider's Theatre Review" Tonight Franklin discusses the upcoming Summer Theatre Season; will it sizzle? Or fizzle? Hear Frank tell it like it is!
As always Upcoming Events and a few surprises!
SLIP! SLAP! SLOP! This Show is HOT!!
Talk to you tonight! 11pm CITR 101.9fm or online at http://citr.ca/

item.title: #56 - "You Pick the Playlist" with guest host Nicole Buckley
item.description:
Over the years of doing a radio show, a lot of people have come up and said "oh man, it would be so cool to do a show" or "I wish I could do what you do". So that got CabaRadio to thinking...why not give you the chance to do just that! That's when we came up with the idea of 'You pick the Playlist' a show where you, one of our listeners gets to come on the show and pick the music for the night. Not only that but you get to talk about why you wanted it played, or what it means to you, or hell maybe you just really dig the song! Maybe you want to play an 80's set, or a punk set, maybe you are like us and you wanna play a whole bunch of different music all on the same show or maybe just maybe you are a musician and you wanna showcase all your own stuff, you can do that to...it's your Playlist! Their are a few rules of course, like you have to play some Canadian Content aka CANCON and you have to play some female content aka FEMCON but other than that, the mic and music is all yours.
Join us tonight http://citr.ca/ at 11pm as burlesque sensation and CabaRadio listener, Nicole Buckley aka Burlesque sensation, Lydia DeCarllo becomes CabaRadio's DJ for the night!!
The adventure awaits tonight at 11pm on CITR 101.9fm or online at http://citr.ca/
Let's go!
PS if you would like to Pick the Playlist some night on CabaRadio please email us at cabaradio@gmail.com with the subject "I wanna pick the playlist" We do it every couple of months, so sign up now and start picking your list!

item.title: #50 - Is Vancouver still no fun? Or just not fun right away? Find out tonight!
item.description:
First something to make you smile: http://www.funnyordie.com/videos/ee5ed10d77/boobies-and-kittens _____________________________________________________________ TONIGHT:
Last June, CabaRadio interviewed the documentary crew of 'No Fun City' live in studio. Back then, the documentary was still finding it's voice; the Olympics were on their way, the Cobalt was still around and their were so many more stories to capture...but after many more months of capturing historic moments in Vancouver, the documentary is cut, polished and ready for the world as it makes its debut at the DOXA Documentary Film Festival, which runs May 7th-16th 2010. Tonight, Kate Kroll make her return to the studio to talk about their journey and how the documentary has changed over the last year. Is Vancouver still a 'No Fun City'? FInd out tonight. To get tickets to the DOXA and 'No Fun City' click here http://www.doxafestival.ca/festival/films/no_fun_city.html
Plus Suzy Shamless of the Terminal City Roller Girls returns to CabaRadio to talk about the newest Derby Season! This season promises to be bigger and badder then ever! What should Suzy write on her stomach? Phone in tonight to have your say! 604-UBC-CITR And Franklin T Schneider hits us up with his latest 'Franklin T. Schneider's Theatre Review"
As always Upcoming Events and a few surprises!
That's all tonight on: CabaRadio w/ Teddy Smooth Tuesdays at 11pm CITR 101.9fm or online citr.ca
Talk to you tonight! _____________________________________________________________ NEXT WEEK It's our preview of the 5th Annual International Burlesque Festival! Check out http://www.vanburlesquefest.com/ for all the details and make sure this year between May 6th-9th you make your way to the 5th Annual International Burlesque Festival...you won't forget it!! _____________________________________________________________ MISSED A SHOW? item.title: #35 - Our New Year's Eve Gala! With special thanks to you!
item.description:
The year is almost up and 2009 was a hard one for many of us. The media blitzed us with poor economic news and gave us details about some pig that could fly. But out at UBC something amazing took place! Two guys came together to create one of the worlds finest variety shows. A radio show like no other was born and out of the ashes of the past came CabaRadio with Teddy Smooth!
At CabaRadio we have had an amazing year! We started the show in April at http://citr.ca/ out at UBC and it's been a whirlwind of fun since day one! Some notable moments include; DJ K-Tel playing as maestro of music on Episode one, CANCON BOOBS! Burgandy Brixx and the Purrfessor of Kitty Nights and then again playing live as part of the cast of 'The Wall'! Franklin T. Scheider's Theatre Review! Radio Play Madness! We had sexual lube tasting with Suzy Shamless! The Halloween Spooktacular! Talents Time with Paul Anthony! Our Photography Special! And of course, The First Annual Holiday Explosion Show!! Ho Ho Ho!
Let's not forget about, live music and interviews with bands like; Big John Bates and the Voodoo Dollz, Wintermitts, Natalie Edward, Blackberry Wood, the Marmaladies! And music by you with 'You Pick the Playlist'
Thank you so much for tuning in this year, it's been an amazing and fun filled adventure that I'm glad you are a part of! Tuesday nights at 11pm on http://citr.ca/ 101.9fm is a night we share and I hope you will continue to listen in 2010 as we delve into new and exciting shows! Check it out at: http://feeds.feedburner.com/Citr--Cabaradio
_____________________________________________________________
TONIGHT: Teddy & Eroc want to share New Year's Eve early with you! So why not get together with some friends, bring a little bubbly, don't forget the radio or computer tuned into 101.9fm or online at http://citr.ca/ and share some laughs and good times with your friends at CabaRadio! Tonight's selection of music will make you wanna dance, move, shake and sit back and think and as we share some of our favourite tunes with you! Do you have some music you wanna share or request? Post the song including name & artist on our facebook page or msg Teddy directly with the song you wanna hear and why?
So come and celebrate New Year's Eve a little early with CabaRadio! Tonight at 11pm CITR 101.9fm or online http://citr.ca/

item.title: #23 - You Pick the Playlist!
item.description:
First off I'd like to thank all the listeners and friends who voted Teddy Smooth(and E-Rock) as 3rd best "Late Night Radio DJ(s)" in the "Best of the Georgia Straight". It was quite the honour to open the Straight on Thurday and see that! From the bottom of CabaRadio's heart we thank you for thinking of us and we hope to continue to make CabaRadio one of the most fun, creative and wacky shows you can listen to late night!! http://www.straight.com/content/best-of-vancouver/culture?page=1 ---------------------------------------------------- Secondly, if you have missed a show or want to check out CabaRadio for the first time please check out http://citr.ca/ under shows and find CabaRadio under the letter "C" or you can find us on Itunes store search citr -- cabaradio
http://feeds.feedburner.com/Citr--Cabaradio ----------------------------------------------------- TONIGHT:
On tonight's episode of CabaRadio, a special treat, as one of our listeners is picking the playlist! It's our 2nd edition of "You pick the playlist!"
Many of you have expressed interest in being on radio and here at CabaRadio we thought we would help that dream come true by creating a special show where in fact the entire music selection is made by you...the listener! Their are some rules like you have to play 35% Canadian Content, the list must include some female content and the songs must tell a story of why you are picking them. Other than that it's all up to you and where you want to take us on this magical, musical journey!
If you would like to be a part of a show like this in the future contact CabaRadio at cabaradio@gmail.com with the subject line "I want to pick CabaRadio's playlist"
On tonight's show CabaRadio listener Seanic Boom is planning a cover to cover edition of "You Pick the Playlist!. Sean show us how some songs we know from today were actually hits a long time ago, only most of us have never known that. Tonight however we will learn! So tune in for a night of music, picked by one of you...the listener!
Plus Upcoming events and a few other surprises!
That's all tonight!

item.title: #22 - The Working Man's Show!
item.description:
Have you ever had a day job? What's the best job you have ever had? What's the worst? On tonight's CabaRadio, Teddy & Erock discuss the ups and downs of being a working stiff. From some of the worst to some of the best, the dynamic duo delve into the world of day jobs and getting the job done. Teddy Smooth even does a live version of "Day Job" his solo song from the hit musical "Shine - A burlesque musical".

item.title: #21 - CabaRadio goes queer
item.description:
Vancouver is known for many things; weed, beautiful people, weed, the outdoors, weed and of course our love of the gays! So it should come as no surprise that Vancouver will be one the first places to not only celebrate being gay but have a Hall of Fame as well. On Saturday September 19th, 2009, the Westin Bayshore Hotel in downtown Vancouver will be the place to be and be seen. The CIBC Pride Network and Qmunity have teamed up to present the first annual Q-Ball, a formal, red carpet, black tie gala fundraiser for Qmunity. The Q Hall of Fame will recognize those that have made significant contributions to the struggle for human rights and full equality for lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgendered Canadians.
And tonight on CabaRadio will be talking to one of the organizers of the Q Ball who will be studio to talk about why this event is so important and why it not only involves the queer community but the hetero one as well.
As always upcoming event, groovy tunes and a few surprises!
That's tonight at 11pm on CabaRadio 101.9fm or online citr.ca
Here's a fun game to play: http://www.squirtgame.com/
www.qhalloffame.ca http://www.facebook.com/pages/Q-Ball/108874951461?ref=mf
item.itunes:subtitle: A night of celebrating all that is queer

item.title: #19 - Fringe Festival Revue
item.description:
So after last week's Tuesday off, CabaRadio is back and ready to talk Fringe! Celebrating 25 years, the Vancouver International Fringe Festival gets under way Sept. 9th and who better to guide us through this crazy festival, then our very own theatre expert, Franklin T. Schneider. Now usually Franklin comes in and does a short review of the goings on of theatre in Vancouver but because of the magnitude of the Fringe, CabaRadio has invited Franklin to spent a much longer time with us as we talk everything Fringe.
Also, Retro Cabaret is back and this time we look at "The Revuers"
Plus upcoming events, music dedicated to the cast & crew of "Shine - A Burlesque Musical" and a few surprises!
Tune in to have fun!
**PLEASE NOTE** Podcast is much longer than usual because on this episode, CabaRadio has also included it's segment CabaRadio - After Dark, where every week after the show we selected a CD to take you musically through the night. Now usually we don't include it on the podcast but the music was so good, this week, we had to!...The music this week was "Jump, Jive & Wail - A history of Swing"...Enjoy

item.title: #12 - "You Pick the Playlist"
item.description:
On tonight's episode of CabaRadio, a special treat, as one of our listeners is picking the playlist! It's our very first "You pick the playlist!"
Many of you have expressed interest in being on radio and here at CabaRadio we thought we would help that dream come true by creating a special show where in fact thee entire music selection is made by you...the listener! Their are some rules like you have to play 35% Canadian Content, the list must include some female content and the songs must tell a story of why you are picking them. Other than that it's all up to you and where you want to take us on this magical, musical journey!
If you would like to be a part of a show like this in the future contact CabaRadio at cabaradio@gmail.com with the subject line "I want to pick CabaRadio's playlist"
On tonight's show CabaRadio listener J Biz has promised to take us back in time to have a listen to some of Canada's top artists, before they hit it big. So tune in for a night of music, picked by one of you...the listener!
Plus Upcoming events and a few other surprise
That's all tonight!
CabaRadio with Teddy Smooth Tuesdays at 11pm 101.9fm or online at citr.ca Check out past episodes on Itunes search "citr -- cabaradio"
item.itunes:subtitle: A special presentation - You, the listener, get to pick the playlist!

item.title: #11 - Sexual Lube Tastings and the Marmaladies Live!
item.description:
If you're like us you've probably wondered at some point what the heck is with all the sexual lube flavours?! Their seems to be so many flavours and some of the flavours are just plain strange...like the other day I was reading about bacon flavoured lube..wtf! The bacon lube got me thinking about all the different kinds of lube and why people would use them. Like the classic Pina Colada, do people actually use it? Or is it just a party gag that you give to a friend? What about strawberry, or strawberry cheesecake? It smells like a strawberry shortcake doll, wouldn't just a regular man/woman taste better than that?
Well tonight on CabaRadio we're going to expose which flavours are the best, which aren't and which ones you just want to say...WHAT THE FUCK?! Suzy Shamless will be joining us live in studio will a shwack of lube and a whole load of determination, as she breaks down the flavours one by one!
Plus musical guest "The Marmaladies"
Upcoming events and more...
CabaRadio with Teddy Smooth Tuesdays at 11pm 101.9fm or online citr.ca Podcast on Itunes search "citr -- cabaradio"
http://www.myspace.com/marmaladies http://terminalcityrollergirls.com/
item.itunes:subtitle: Sexual Lube exposed! Plus awesome live music!
